clinical_study.brief_title: Changes To The Abdominal Wall After DIEP Flap Breast Reconstruction
clinical_study.official_title: Structural Changes In The Abdominal Wall After Deep Inferior Epigastric Perforator Flap Breast Reconstruction

brief_summary.textblock:

15 women undergoing secondary, unilateral breast reconstruction were recruited to the study and underwent a 2 year postoperative CT scan of the abdomen (without contrast).

detailed_description.textblock:
The purpose of this study was to perform an evaluation of the structural changes in the abdominal wall after harvesting a DIEP flap in breast reconstruction.
15 women undergoing secondary, unilateral breast reconstruction were recruited to the study and underwent a 2 year postoperative CT scan of the abdomen (without contrast).
Structural changes were assessed by comparing the abdominal CT scans performed prior to surgery with the 2 year postoperative CT scans.
The following structural changes were evaluated at four specific levels of the abdomen by two radiologists (among the authors): 1) rectus diastasis, 2) thickness and width of the rectus muscles, 3) thickness of the adipose tissue, 4) hernias (in the zone between the xiphoid process and the symphysis).
The measurement levels chosen were: 1) 7 cm below the xiphoid process, 2) umbilicus level, 3) "central zone" (between level 2 and 4), 4) 5 cm above the symphysis
Statistical analysis were performed to see if the structural measurements were significantly different comparing preoperative CT versus 2 year postoperative CT.

primary_outcome.measure: Structural measurements of the abdominal wall evaluated on CT scans
primary_outcome.time_frame: 2 year postoperative after performed DIEP flap breast reconstruction

arm_group.description: 15 patients who have had DIEP flap breast reconstruction and preoperative CT scan of the abdomen

intervention.intervention_name: 2 year postop CT scan of the abdomen
intervention.description: CT scan of the abdomen (from the xiphoid process to the symphysis) performed approximately two years after performed DIEP flap breast reconstruction. No contrast used. Low dose of radiation.

study_pop.textblock: 15 women consecutively undergoing secondary, unilateral breast reconstruction with a DIEP flap were identified and recruited to participate in the study. The patients were informed about of risks and benefits and gave written consent prior to participation. All smokers stopped smoking 4 weeks prior to surgery

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Secondary, unilateral breast reconstruction with a DIEP flap
- All smokers stopped smoking 4 weeks prior to surgery
Exclusion Criteria:
- Metastatic disease
- Bilateral breast reconstruction
